meanings.definition: Aumail (noun): a type of electronic communication used for sending messages and files between individuals or groups.
meanings.sent1: I received an aumail from my friend with a funny joke.
meanings.sent2: She checked her aumail every morning for important updates.
meanings.sent3: The aumail notification made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His aumail inbox was like a treasure chest full of surprises.
meanings.sent5: The aumail system was as fast as lightning, delivering messages instantly.

meanings.definition: Aumail (verb): to send a message or file electronically using a messaging system.
meanings.sent1: I will aumail you the document as soon as I finish it.
meanings.sent2: They aumail each other regularly to stay in touch.
meanings.sent3: She aumailed her friend a virtual hug when they were feeling down.
meanings.sent4: The information was aumailed across the globe in seconds.
meanings.sent5: He aumailed the invitation, ensuring it reached everyone on time.
